items.definition: Count of conversations where the “Answers” module was triggered.
Count of questions asked by the users.
Count of user queries where the bot was able to provide an answer.
Count of user queries where the bot responded with a Q&A recommendation.
Count of feedback provided by the users when the bot responded with a Q&A recommendation.
Count of positive feedback provided by the users when the bot responded with a Q&A recommendation.
Count of negative feedback provided by the users when the bot responded with a Q&A recommendation.
Count of Q&A recommendation where the users didn’t provide feedback.
Count of user queries where the fallback action was triggered and the bot could not come up with a response.

Count of messages sent in an interaction.
The type of the message (carousel, drop down, calendar, image, attachments, private note, mention, etc).
Nested: User (name), agent (name), API, BOT.

The current status of the bot conversation (Open, Closed).
The unique dialog ID corresponding to the message on the bot conversation (dialog id is shown beside each node configured on the bot builder).
The type of feedback response shown to the customer - star rating , opinion poll, comment.
Star rating value of the Feedback provided by the user .

Name of he bot on which the conversation was initiated.

A new or reopened (after resolution) conversation thread in a channel.

The count/percentage of conversations handed over to the agent by the bot.
The count/percentage of conversations where the end-user left the conversation without reaching the logical end of the bot flow.
Count of messages sent in an interaction.
The number of messages users send before a conversation is abandoned or resolved.
The number of messages sent by the bot before a conversation is abandoned or resolved..
A unique identifier for the user that interacts with the bot.
The URL on which the bot conversation was initiated.

Timestamp at which the bot conversation was initiated.
A unique alphanumeric identifier for any conversation with the bot.
Current status of the conversation. For example, New, open, unassigned, assigned, resolved, deleted, Any (includes all interactions).

The version of the bot on which the conversation was initiated.
Name of the flow on which the conversation was triggered.

The mode of agent handover for a bot conversation.
A custom parameter that can be set to capture a particular variable during the course of a bot conversation.
The language to understand the performance of multilingual bots.

Bot name as available on the bots UI.

Time a caller spent on an IVR menu.

definition: Time taken after agent assignment to send the first response, considering the business hours. If no agent is assigned and the first response has been provided, the first response time will be calculated based on:
1. The time the conversation was initiated or,
2. The time the conversation was handed over by the bot.

items.definition: Time taken post-initiation to assign the conversation to a group.
Time taken post-initiation to assign the conversation to a group (only including business hours in time calculation).
Time taken post-initiation to assign the conversation to a group (only including business hours in time calculation).

The time from the first agent assignment to resolution. If the agent responded before assignment or if there's no agent assignment, it's the time from conversation creation or bot handover to resolution.
Time taken post-initiation to assign the conversation to an agent.
Time taken post-initiation, to assign the conversation to an agent (only including business hours in time calculation).

The time from the first agent assignment to the last agent response. If the agent responded before assignment or if there's no agent assignment, it's the time from conversation creation or bot handover to the last agent response.
Time taken to get first response from the time conversation was initiated (only including business hours in time calculation).
Time taken to get the first response from the time the conversation was initiated, regardless of the business hours.
No. of stars selected by user on CSAT survey.
Count of agent messages across conversations.
Count of user messages across conversations.
Count of conversations where a CSAT was provided.
Time taken to re-assign a chat to another agent after the first assignment (only including business hours in time calculation).
Time taken to re-assign a chat to another agent after the first assignment, regardless of the business hours (only including business hours in time calculation).
Time taken to re-assign a chat to another group after the first assignment (only including business hours in time calculation).
Time taken to re-assign a chat to another group after the first assignment, regardless of the business hours (only including business hours in time calculation).
The time at which a group was assigned to a conversation.
Reason for a conversation getting reopened - New, Customer Reopen, Agent Reopen, DSAT Reopen.
Timestamp when interaction was assigned to an agent anytime (new or reopened).
Timestamp when an interaction was first assigned to an agent (new or reopened).
Timestamp when interaction was created (new or reopened).
Current status of the conversation: Unassigned, Assigned, Resolved, Deleted, Any (includes all interactions).
Timestamp when interaction was resolved (new or reopened).
Whether the interaction was initiated within business hours. True or False.
Platform from where the conversation was initiated: MOBILE, WEBCHAT, FACEBOOK_MESSENGER, WHATSAPP, FB_NATIVE, ABC, LINE.
Yes or No response to CSAT question.
Chat group to which the interaction is assigned.
Label category applied to an interaction post-resolution.
Label subcategory applied to an interaction post-resolution.
Email ID of the agent profile.
Timezone in which the agent's profile has been set up.
Name of the agent.
Unique identifier for every interaction on chat.
Unique identifier for an sla policy.
Count of agent responses on an interaction.
Count of interactions that adhered to the SLA policy.
Provides the count of interactions where SLA breached due first response not going within the specified time.
Provides the count of interactions where SLA breached due next response not going within the specified time.
Yes or No response to CSAT question.
Identifier to understand if a conversation has first response due or response due.
The timestamp at which an interaction was initiated.
Amount of time an agent was active on IntelliAssign (in seconds).
The timestamp at which the agent was marked active on IntelliAssign.
The timestamp at which the agent was marked inactive on IntelliAssign.
Email ID of the agents' profile.
Name of the agent.
Group to which an agent belongs.
Count of unique conversations.
Provides an average beginning sentiment value on a scale of 3. 1 -> Negative , 2 -> Neutral , 3 -> Negative.
Provides an average ending sentiment value on a scale of 3. 1 -> Negative , 2 -> Neutral , 3 -> Negative.
Unique conversation ID.
Unique conversation identifier , this has a 1:1 mapping with conversation id (can be used to aggregate at a conversation level on analytics).
Provides information on the mode of resolution - agent, auto_resolve, api_resolved.
Provides the initial channel of conversation (webchat, facebook, whatsapp , instagram, phone).
Current status of the conversation - Open ,waiting on customer, waiting on internal team, or resolved.
Name of the topic from which conversation was initiated.
Timestamp of the last update on the conversation.
Provides on information on the actor who resolved the conversation - agent , system or automation.
Timestamp at which the conversation was initiated.
The initial user sentiment for a conversation - Positive, negative, neutral.
The closing user sentiment for a conversation - Positive, negative , neutral.
Value of the label sub category of the conversation.
Value of the label category of the conversation.
Name of the currently assigned agent.
Name of the currently assigned group.

Elapsed time to first group assigned during Calendar Hours.
